description: Latin maturatus, past participle of maturare (“to make ripe”).

verbs.description: maturate (third-person singular simple present maturates, present participle maturating, simple past and past participle maturated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring to ripeness or maturity; to ripen.
examples: A tree may be maturated artificially.

entries.meaning: (medicine, transitive) To promote the perfect suppuration of (an abscess).
